name: Seahorse Tropical Da Nang Hotel by Haviland
address: 29 Yen Bai, Hai Chau , Đà Nẵng, Việt Nam
description:
Nằm tại vị trí thuận tiện ở trung tâm Đà Nẵng, Seahorse Tropical Da Nang Hotel by Haviland cung cấp Wi-Fi miễn phí ở toàn bộ chỗ nghỉ, hồ bơi ngoài trời và chỗ đậu xe riêng miễn phí cho khách lái xe. Ngoài quầy lễ tân 24 giờ, chỗ nghỉ này còn có sân hiên. Đây là chỗ nghỉ không gây dị ứng và tọa lạc cách Trung tâm thương mại Indochina Riverside 4 phút đi bộ.

Các phòng đều có phòng tắm riêng được trang bị vòi sen, các phòng tại khách sạn có TV màn hình phẳng và điều hòa, ngoài ra một số phòng có ban công.

Khách tại Seahorse Tropical Da Nang Hotel by Haviland có thể thưởng thức bữa sáng thực đơn buffet.

Các điểm tham quan nổi tiếng gần chỗ nghỉ bao gồm Cầu sông Hàn, Bảo tàng điêu khắc Chăm và Cầu khóa Tình yêu Đà Nẵng. Sân bay gần nhất là Sân bay Quốc tế Đà Nẵng, cách Seahorse Tropical Da Nang Hotel by Haviland 3 km, đồng thời chỗ nghỉ có cung cấp dịch vụ đưa đón sân bay mất phí.

review.room_type: Giường Tầng Trong Phòng Ngủ Tập Thể Cho Nam Và Nữ
review.comment_positive: I really enjoyed my stay at Seahorse Tropical. I would say the most major highlight was how nicely air conditioned the room was (especially since I was there during summer in Vietnam). I say this because I had been staying in other air conditioned rooms and still found myself waking up with beads of sweat on me, so in this case, when they say air conditioned they mean it. Other things I liked about my stay was how accommodating and kind the staff was. Any request I had they were able to help me with and were very kind while doing it. I also liked that there was free water for guests, and a pool area (not too big or too much seating but still nice and peaceful). Also, every morning there is a lovely spread of breakfast at the hotel that looked great. I never had it since it was a bit more than I wanted to pay (I think somewhere over 120,000 dong), but from everyone I asked it was delicious (and buffet style).
review.comment_negative: The location wasn't amazing since it was not located on the island that is across the bridge. The food I found in the area nearby is best described as mediocre and I most often found myself renting a motorbike to go to the downtown area to get delicious food. However, there were wonderful coffee shops nearby and great bakeries that served delicious little deserts. Great place to stay and a great price, but just expect to spend a bit extra to call a taxi or get a motorbike to go more to the downtown area for dinner.

review.rating: My fave hotel in Da Nang!
review.comment_positive:
Gorgeous hotel, I stayed in a couple of the studios, the larger one was perfect for solo or couple. The location was cool, right next to a supermarket, not too far from anything in a Grab and the best part was the staff - especially the lovely Thanh Truyen who was so helpful and Hai Yen and the rest of the staff whose names I didn't get - thank you!!
Clean, comfortable hotel with a cute rooftop pool, I would definitely stay again.

Aufenthalt 2 Nächte, wären wir länger geblieben, wären wir auch gerne länger in diesem Hotel geblieben. Die Betten waren sehr bequem. In der Nacht war es sehr ruhig, am Morgen hörte man teilweise die immer hupenden Scooter/Autofahrer. Die Lage war sehr gut. Wenige Gehminuten zur Drachenbrücke, viele Lokale in unmittelbarer Umgebung, der Nachtmarkt gleich über der Drachenbrücke. Zum Strand ist es zu weit zum Gehen, aber beim Hotel gibts einen Scooter für 180.000 VDN/Tag (in den anderen Ortschaften zahlten wir 30.000 VDN weniger, was aber auch nur knapp mehr als 1 Euro entspricht) Preis-Leistung sehr gut.

Vị trí khách sạn ngay trung tâm thành phố, cách Chợ Hàn 200m, bạn có thể đi bộ 5 phút để tới Chợ Hàn hoặc nhà thờ con gà. Lễ tân đón tiếp mình rất nhiệt tình, có sẵn welcome drink cho các KH check in tại khách san, đấy là điểm cộng không phải nơi nào cũng có. Phòng cực kỳ sạch sẽ, thiết kế mang phong cách thuyền và biển, mình rất thích phòng ở đây, cảm giác yên bình. Buffet sáng rất ngon, có nhiều món Âu và món Việt được kết hợp, ngoài ra, thức uống và trái cây tráng miệng rất tươi. Hồ bơi phía trên là điểm cộng rất sáng cho kỳ nghỉ của mình. Được ngắm nhìn thành phố về đêm phía trên tầng cao nhất của tòa nhà có thể nhìn thấy toàn cảnh thành phố, rất thích.

review.comment_positive: Die Lage ist sehr zentral. Es gibt eine Tiefgarage für Roller. Gratis. Das Zimmer schaut sehr modern aus und hatte sogar eine kleine Küchenzeile. review.rating: Achtung! Es wird mit Balkon geworben, ist aber freundlich gesagt „irreführend“
review.comment_positive:
Gute Lage. Schöner Eingangsbereich. 
Teekanne mit losem Tee auf dem Zimmer war sehr schön.
review.comment_negative:
Vorweg: wir buchen prinzipiell immer Zimmer mit Balkon. Hier wurde das Zimmer mit Balkon auf Booking offeriert. Als wir ankamen: gab es einfach keinen. 
Wir haben bei der Rezeption angerufen und darauf hingewiesen, dass das Zimmer auf Booking mit Balkon angeworben wird. Antwort „wieso, hat doch einen Garten.“
Der „Garten“ hier im Bild anbei. Spoiler Alarm: es gibt keinen. Kein Fenster ermöglicht es irgendwo hinauszugehen. Es gäbe auch keine Fläche um herauszugehen. 

Wir hätten für einen geringeren Preis deutlich bessere Zimmer ohne Balkon bekommen, wenn wir das denn gewollt hätten. Wir fühlen uns komplett betrogen und möchten den Betreiber dringend auffordern, den Balkon aus der Beschreibung zu entfernen, wenn es sich hier nicht um absichtlichen Betrug handeln sollte.

Zum Zimmer: die Böden waren nicht wirklich sauber (Socken und Füße schmutzig). Es gab in dem Doppelzimmer das für 2 Personen gebucht wurde auch nur einen Satz Besteck und ein Glas,…. In der Minibar 1 Bier.. komisch. Aber nicht weltbewegend. 

Die Fenster sind defekt und lassen sich nicht richtig schließen. Daher ist der Lärm der Straße (laute Musik bis 2 Uhr nachts) sehr laut im Zimmer zu hören. 

Duschkabine undicht. Alles Wasser läuft hinter das WC. 

Alles in allem: wir würden niemandem den Aufenthalt empfehlen, da wir nicht von der Aufrichtigkeit der Betreiber überzeugt sind. Es wirkt so, als ob auf Booking einfach alles angeklickt wurde, um so viele Menschen wie möglich ins Hotel zu locken. Wir sind schwer enttäuscht

review.comment_positive: The best part was the rooftop pool, the second best the aesthetically pleasing building, including the rooms. Breakfast was pretty good, too, especially the little omelettes. My wife and our son also liked the soup, which changes every day. As for Western food, choices are limited, to put it mildly: the same kind of cheese (Edam?) and strawberry jam every morning. Coffee was lousy and bitter; it tasted like machine oil, like they had boiled a pound of Robusta for an hour.
review.comment_negative: Once, we asked the receptionist to call us a taxi. She didn't. Instead, she fumbled with her phone and asked me where to. When I replied: "to the beach"—although that's obviously not really her business--she told me that was too unspecific. I reiterated that we wanted her to call a cab, but when she still didn't pick up the phone, we just left. We ended up walking all the way, which was nice, but exhausting. Later, the young lady apologized, saying that she didn't have the cab company's number (even though it's written on every cab's door). When we asked for a cab to be called two days later, it took only a very short time to arrive. I didn't enjoy the moment when I had to watch her fiddle with her phone for no obvious reason, and I still find it ludicrous that a hotel reception can't call a cab.

review.comment_positive:
The staff was really professional and went beyond their way to help us out. We had forgotten our medicine pouch in the room after checking out. They got in touch with us quickly and then couriered it to us at our next hotel. They did this promptly and kept us posted throughout. They even helped organise a bike for us while we were there. 

The decor of the room and the hotel in general was very nice! They have used natural materials in a very pleasing and balanced way. The tea set that they provided in the room was exceptional – it came with loose leaf tea, a kettle with a built-in sieve and two beautiful ceramic cups. 

We had a lovely view of the emerging skyline in the vibrant city of Da Nang. The room had a balcony and natural light coming in from 2 directions. 

The location is convenient. It's in the heart of the city – just 10-15 minutes from any other part of the city including the airport!

Really good stay in Seahorse , staff were so helpful and friendly they supported me a lot with my questions. Location is good, just take 3 minutes walking to Han Market and Han River. The view of the swimming pool on rooftop is nice and delicious breakfast from 1st floor.

Vietnam and Danang in particular makes excellent bread (banh mi) so why do hotels like Seahorse refuse to serve it and only serve industrially produced white sliced bread? I never comprehend this failure on the part of many hotels not only seahorse. Otherwise the coffee was so thick you could stand a spoon up in it and there were more cakes than savoury items. breakfast outside would be better.
It's not the hotel's fault but there is ghastly karaoke outside until past 10.30; maybe there are quieter areas. This is a real menace for all cities in Vietnam and the authorities should act.

review.comment_positive:
Pěkný velký pokoj, všude čisto, krásný bazén, dobrá poloha hotelu.
Na recepci velmi milý personál, ochotný pomoci, obsluha kavárny rovněž milá, bohužel neumí anglicky, domluvit se není jednoduché. Na snídani výběr jen ze tří jídel. Třikrát jsem zkoušela objednat čaj bez cukru, třikrát mě ujistili, že není slazený a bohužel to neklaplo.. ale to je ve Vietnamu obecně problém, nápoje podávají vždy velmi sladké, pravděpodobně už mají cukr ve směsi s čajem, nebo kávou...
Co se týče snídaně, nebo nápojů, není problém si zajít někam k sousedům..
Do hotelu bych se klidně vrátila, byly jsme spokojené.

review.rating: Ein richtig schönes und modernes Hotel für einen tollen Preis.
review.comment_positive: Ein großartiges Erlebnis in diesem Hotel übernachtet zu haben. Die Unterkunft ist richtig fancy, hat auch beispielsweise ein öffentliches Café im Erdgeschoss. Die unteren Stockwerke sind Offices, die oberen sind den Hotelgästen vorbehalten. Das Zimmer hatte einen atemberaubenden Ausblick auf die Stadt, die Ausstattung war super (Klimaanlage, Smart TV, kleine Küchenzeile, Lounge am Fenster, modernes Bad, Diffuser). Dank des Diffusers roch es immer großartig. Das Bett war sehr gemütlich. Auf dem Dach des Hotels gibt es einen Infinity-Pool, von dem aus man die ganze Stadt sehen kann. Unser Aufenthalt war viel zu kurz, gerne wären wir länger geblieben.
review.comment_negative: Auch in den oberen Stockwerken kriegt man den Straßenlärm (Tag und Nacht) mit - daran muss man sich in Vietnam aber auch gewöhnen. Der Pool hatte leider nur zwei Liegen, der Andrang (im März) war aber auch nicht groß.

review.comment_negative:
Dortoirs de 4 lits, je m'attendais à un espace calme, mais pas du tout. Les murs sont si fins qu'on entend tout ce qui se passe à l'étage. Donc si les autres clients sont bruyants, c'est extrêmement désagréable, ce qui a été mon cas. 
Le personnel ne m'a jamais donné les mêmes informations et réponses à ma question pourtant, me semble-t-il pas compliquée, à savoir : comment aller en bus public à Hoi An. Même les prix des taxis n'étaient pas les mêmes. Bref personnel poli mais franchement pas utile et bon payer un taxi plus cher que le prix de la chambre ...

review.rating: Un bon hôtel mais avec quelques défauts.
review.comment_positive:
C'est hôtel est bon mais sans plus, je peine à comprendre la note fabuleuse qui lui est attribuée ici. C'est vrai, l'hôtel est bon en regard du prix, le studio est de bonne qualité et l'accueil est bon également. La vue depuis les étages élevés est belle et la piscine sur le toit agréable pour ceux qui aiment. Il y a deux systèmes de climatisation différents dans le studio (je ne suis pas certain de la réelle utilité, surtout que la lumière du ventilateur au plafond ne fonctionnait pas), l'une des deux est suffisamment silencieuse, la cuisine est correctement aménagée et la douche fonctionnelle.

Sauf qu'un hôtel est avant tout fait pour se reposer, et là c'est plus compliqué.
review.comment_negative:
Les fenêtres du studio ne sont pas du tout insonorisées, et la fenêtre de mon balcon ne fermait carrément pas, elle a un défaut, côté gauche. Du coup on entend tout des bruits de la rue, même au dernier étage. Les nuits sont bruyantes, soit un gong qui retentit à différentes heures, soit les karaokés voisins jusqu'à tard, et très tôt le matin il y a aussi un coq tout près qui vous réveille, sans parler des hauts-parleurs de l'école voisine qui diffusent de la musique le matin également. Je sais bien que c'est souvent comme cela en ville au Vietnam, mais des fenêtres de bonne qualité et qui ne sont pas défectueuses peuvent faire toute la différence.
La douche a également un défaut, lorsqu'on ouvre la porte, à chaque fois on entend peu après un gros bruit métallique qui fait un peu peur, on a l'impression que quelque chose est cassé, et elle ne ferme pas complètement.
Il y a un banc et une table guéridon, mais ce n'est pas pratique pour travailler, il faudrait un fauteuil ou une chaise et une vraie table. Le frigo est encombré par des choses à acheter, cela n'a aucun sens: si je loue une chambre de type appartement et non une chambre d'hôtel, c'est pour mettre mes propres affaires, pas pour acheter les vôtres.
A la cuisine, il manque également un linge pour essuyer les couverts ou les mains et quelque chose pour essuyer le plan de travail. Enfin, dans la salle de bain, la lumière du lavabo est très mauvaise: personne ne peut se raser/se maquiller correctement avec une lumière pareille.

Donc oui, cet hôtel est bon, mais il n'est pas "fabuleux".

review.rating: The hotel is great, but beware they sell expensive tours and they are a trap
review.comment_positive: It was a very nice and well-kept hotel. Our suite on the 8th floor was facing the street. The room was very spacious and modernly furnished. It was also very clean. There is the possibility to watch Netflix. The pool on the roof was a dream. We felt comfortable and many thanks to the nice cleaning staff who only came when you left the room.
review.comment_negative:
The accommodation was not easy to find, i.e. the entrance to reception. It is located at the back of the café.
The hotel offers tours. Attention, a trap! We wanted to go to Hoi An with a stop on a sightseeing tour. We were not informed that we would be taken by taxi to the bus, which stopped briefly at another hotel. The guide didn't pay any attention to us. We stopped at a huge shop with figurines for sale for 20min. Then the actual attraction for which we had to pay extra and the guide ignored us. After 40 minutes it was all over, far too little time and unfriendly in Hoi An, suitcases out somewhere and goodbye! The lady from our hotel said we had only booked a "tour". In the end we were simply taken for a ride for a lot of money! Booking a car through Grab is cheaper!

review.rating: Great location, don't bother staying near the beach.
review.comment_positive: The location of this hotel was great. It had lots of choice for restaurants and shopping with in easy walking distance. We got a Grab to the Dragon bridge for the markets and the fire & water show, but then walked back to the hotel over the bridge and via the river after which ended up being only 30mins or so.  This hotel was not within walking distance to the beach but it was easy to catch a grab at about 50,000 VND each way. The pool was great and had a view of the mountains and to the north. I personally loved the balcony bathtub, and it was amusing hearing the karoke in the distance when having a bath. It was very handy having a washing machine also. Breakfast was adequate with enough variety to satify all levels of taste, though I recommend getting coffee across the road.
review.comment_negative:
We had booked the Loft Apartment, and there was some confusion on bedding. The room says it can accomodate 2 adults and a child up to 9 years (which we had a 9 and 11 yr old). I thought this meant there was already a bed available for the 9yr , but there was not - only a couch available, or they expected for the child to sleep in the large bed with the parents. I suggest the hotel change the description of this accomodation. In the end we could fit 2x extra rollaway bed for children, and there was still plenty of room.  We were also sharing 3 towels between the 4 of us for a couple of days until the staff worked out there were 4 of us staying in the room, don't worry we did tell them, I just think they were a bit confused, especially with the bedding situation.
Another suggestion is to make this a specific family room and locate 2 permanent beds (like a bunk bed) on the entry level - there is always a lack of options for family rooms so I'm sure this would create a higher demand!
The tea bench had the microwave down at floor level below the sink in a cupboard, and pretty much unusable. I suggest to relocate to a more usable height.

review.comment_negative:
- Suciedad de la habitación (baño y ventanas)
- Dificultad para comunicarse con las recepcionistas (apenas hablan inglés)
- Solicitamos alquilar transporte privado con conductor para ir a Ba Na Hills y querían comprarnos ellas las entradas (cobrándonos 100.000 dongs más a cada uno de lo que cuesta en taquilla). Al irnos nos dio la factura del alquiler del coche y por detrás nos dio la documentación de otros huéspedes (y a ellos se le había cobrado el precio adecuado por las entradas). Está claro que se han querido aprovechar del turista o de la barrera ideomática para cobrarnos de más.
- Desayuno escaso y no muy variado.
- Creo que hay opciones mejores por el mismo precio.
- Nunca me volvería a alojar allí.

wifi 잘 연결되고, 로비가 아담하였으나 아늑한 느낌과 편안한 느낌을 받아 정말 가성비 갑이구나 하는 생각이 듭니다.
주방설비도 있어서 과일 깍아 먹고 하는데도 부담 없이 좋았습니다.
review.comment_negative:
동일한 명칭의 호텔이 있어서 투어상품 픽업 서비스 받을때 약간 힘들었어요.
낮에는 전혀 문제가 없어 객실이 이뻐 보이나, 밤에는 객실조명이 어두워 조금 우중충한 느낌이랄까..
친구들끼리 오면 가성비 갑 시설이나, 아이들하고 오기에는 다소 애매한 시설인 듯해요.

We loved the local tea and Smart TV with Netflix in the room. The interior & design with modern bamboo shutters were also a nice touch. The pantry was efficient too as the room was not that big but suited our needs.
My son particularly loved the breakfast, well worth the price. We didn't get to use the pool but we took some pictures up there during the evening when the weather was much nicer & cooler.
review.comment_negative: I didn't understand why the reception staff had to go and check the room first upon checking out. Was this a normal procedure? Because if so, imagine if one was running late and they had to wait for the staff to return to them go. Or even, if there were many guests checking out at the same time, would they still apply this procedure?

review.comment_positive: The staff went above and beyond to help me. One staff member in particular helped me with checking my flight. The location is good for the sites like dragon bridge and cham museum and also getting to the aiport. You can take a grab or 1 hour walk to the beach area. The dorm beds are comfy and there's a nice area of tables and chairs to relax in. There are a lot of showers and toilets. The pool on the top floor is amazing! If you wake up early you can go for a morning swim. There are showers there too. Overall, the hotel exceeded my expectations.
